comment.narrative:
1.1 Adaptation Taskforce exists, but needs revitalising and strengthening, with coordination mechanisms enhanced 1.2 Legal standing for RAN-API does not currently exist to govern adaptation unlike the framework for mitigation 1.3 RAN-API of Indon esia has recently been reviewed but needs updating based on developmental priorities, and recent data for thematic areas 1.4 Indonesia has policies established to highlight the need for gender-responsive CCA, and a climate change budgeting system. But there is a need to merge the two concepts for effective implementation of a gender-responsive CCA budget tagging system at the national level.
2.1 Vulnerability assessment has been conducted by SIDIK at the national level, but the parameters are limited and socio-economic indicators are lacking. Gender data is not incorporated into the risk assessments 2.2 Scientific information that can inform indicators is limited. Currently there is only a prototype for the resilience index rather than an actual index 2.3 Climate risk assessment and gender-responsive risk and vulnerability assessments are relatively new concepts for which capacity is not sufficiently prevalent. Stakeholders do not have the skills and technical expertise necessary to conduct gender-responsive climate risk and vulnerability assessments.
3.1 Climate risk assessment is a new concept which was introduced through the IPCC AR5 report, and which has not yet been implemented by many stakeholders in Indonesia. Among government staff and other stakeholders, capacity for developing risk assessments for climate change impacts is limited. 3.2 For Wakatobi there are no gender-responsive climate risk assessments that have been conducted using landscape-based adaptation approaches 3.3 Climate budgeting has been introduced in Indonesia for CCA at the national level, but sub-national level CCA budgeting is not practiced. 3.4 There is no gender-responsive budget tagging system for CCA in Wakatobi

Outcome 1: 1. Adaptation Taskforce strengthened, and ToR developed, with roles, responsibilities and coordination mechanisms determined. 2. RAN-API updated and validated, including approaches for institutional strengthening and cross-sectoral coordination, the establishment of an M&E framework and an analysis of climate risk and vulnerability assessment indicators and impact assessment methodologies for adaptation options.
Outcome 2 1. SIDIK improved and indicators for climate risk and vulnerability developed. 2. Climate risk indicators/indices for the development of a RAN-API M&E framework reviewed and determined and impact assessment methodologies for CCA options defined.
Outcome 3 1. Gender-responsive climate risk assessments conducted in Wakatobi utilizing a landscape-based adaptation approach 2. Capacity of government staff in Wakatobi built on gender-responsive budget tagging for CCA and gender-responsive climate budget tagging guidelines developed.
